    alias noop=‘noop -all’ ## Unix ## Command Line Aliases # Continuously tail file live. # This can be useful when tracking activity. alias tlf=“tail -f” alias ln=‘ln -v’ alias mkdir=‘mkdir -p’ alias …=‘../..’ alias l=‘ls’ alias ll=‘ls -al’ alias lh=‘ls -Alh’

    # Pipe to grep alias -g G=‘| grep’ # Pipe to less alias -g M=‘| less’ # Line count alias -g L=‘| wc -l’ alias -g ONE=“| awk ‘{ print $1}’”

    ## Git alias g=“git” alias gci=“git pull –rebase && rake && git push”

    ## Bundler alias b=“bundle”

    ## Tests and Specs alias t=“ruby -I test” alias cuc=“bundle exec cucumber”

    ## Rubygems alias gi=“gem install” alias giv=“gem install -v”

    ## Rails alias migrate=“rake db:migrate && rake db:rollback && rake db:migrate && rake db:test:prepare”

    [Validate]
